trustfund:
TF020250-FRENCH CONSULTANTS TRUST FUND,TF035845-ALBANIA - RURAL DEVELOPMENT
            PROJECT AND PROPOSED MICROCREDIT PROJ.,TF022683-PHRD-URBAN WORKS &
            MICROENTERPRISE PILOT

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the project is rated
            satisfactory, and sustainability is highly likely. The
            performance of the Bank was highly satisfactory, having
            played a proactive role in project design, by securing grant
            financing for the pre-pilot phase, and actively guiding its
            activities. Similarly, the performance of the borrower was
            satisfactory, who actively implemented work-related, pilot
            urban subprojects during preparation, and, initiated the
            urban micro-credit. Regardless of success, the key lessons
            suggest that: 1) while implementation of the Albanian
            Development Fund (ADF) is commendable, the Board of
            Directors of a social investment fund, should include
            technical specialists, and stakeholders, for, ADF Board of
            Trustees was comprised entirely of Government officials,
            rendering the fund vulnerable to political pressures; 2)
            initially, the project area for urban works, was limited to
            few municipalities, which were non-responsive to ADF's
            requests for co-financing, or subproject maintenance. The
            situation improved as the project area expanded, which due
            to the competitiveness among a larger number of
            municipalities, quality and project implementation largely
            improved. 3) Early technical assistance should have been
            provided to establish sound financial management, and
            transparent practices, to ADF's urban credit
            department, and avoid the current Besa Foundation, from
            handling the financial procedures.
